column4: i know about your problem, i had a similar one the other day and i fixed it
Good to hear! How do I go about doing the same thing?

it involved editing the xorg.conf file to force it to recognize your driver and your resolution etc. , i am a total noob so i couldn't walk you through it with any assurance that i wouldnt mess it up more, but i know that if you go to #compiz and describe your problem to them someone there will be very able to help you
thanks! I'm going to google it first though, to see if anything comes up :)
